title: workers.yaml
description: A result of app deployment. This file is created automatically after successful deployment using `fluence workers deploy` command

deals.description: Info about deals created when deploying workers that is stored by environment that you deployed to

definition.description: CID of uploaded to IPFS App Definition, which contains the data about everything that you are trying to deploy, including spells, service and module configs and CIDs for service wasms

timestamp.description: ISO timestamp of the time when the worker was deployed

dealId.description: Lowercased version of dealIdOriginal without 0x prefix. Currently unused. Was previously used to resolve workers in aqua

dealIdOriginal.description: Blockchain transaction id that you get when deploy workers. Can be used in aqua to get worker and host ids. Check out example in the aqua generated in the default template

chainNetwork.description: DEPRECATED. Blockchain network name that was used when deploying workers

chainNetworkId.description: Blockchain network id that was used when deploying workers

additionalProperties.description: Contains data related to your deployment, including, most importantly, deal id, that can be used to resolve workers in aqua

Worker_deployed_using_deals.description: Contains data related to your deployment, including, most importantly, deal id, that can be used to resolve workers in aqua

hosts.description: Info about directly deployed workers that is stored by environment that you deployed to

custom.description: A map of directly deployed workers

definition.description: CID of uploaded to IPFS App Definition, which contains the data about everything that you are trying to deploy, including spells, service and module configs and CIDs for service wasms

timestamp.description: ISO timestamp of the time when the worker was deployed

dummyDealId.description: random string generated by CLI, used in Nox. You can get worker id from it

host_id.description: Can be used to access worker in aqua: `on s.workerId via s.hostId`

spell_id.description: id of the installation spell, can be used to e.g. print spell logs

worker_id.description: Can be used to access worker in aqua: `on s.workerId via s.hostId`

relayId.description: relay peer id that was used when deploying

additionalProperties.description: Contains data related to your direct deployment. Most importantly, it contains ids in installation_spells property that can be used to resolve workers in aqua

definition.description: CID of uploaded to IPFS App Definition, which contains the data about everything that you are trying to deploy, including spells, service and module configs and CIDs for service wasms

timestamp.description: ISO timestamp of the time when the worker was deployed

dummyDealId.description: random string generated by CLI, used in Nox. You can get worker id from it

host_id.description: Can be used to access worker in aqua: `on s.workerId via s.hostId`

spell_id.description: id of the installation spell, can be used to e.g. print spell logs

worker_id.description: Can be used to access worker in aqua: `on s.workerId via s.hostId`

relayId.description: relay peer id that was used when deploying

Worker_deployed_using_direct_hosting.description: Contains data related to your direct deployment. Most importantly, it contains ids in installation_spells property that can be used to resolve workers in aqua
